verses.verse: in all things showing yourself to be (Phil. 3:17; 1 Tim. 4:12) a pattern of good works; in doctrine showing integrity, reverence, (Eph. 6:24) incorruptibility,
sound speech that cannot be condemned, that one who is an opponent may be ashamed, having nothing evil to say of you.
Exhort (Eph. 6:5; 1 Tim. 6:1) bondservants to be obedient to their own masters, to be well pleasing in all things, not answering back,
not pilfering, but showing all good fidelity, that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Savior in all things.
Trained by Saving Grace For ((Rom. 5:15)) the grace of God that brings salvation has appeared to all men,
teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly in the present age,
(1 Cor. 1:7) looking for the blessed ((Col. 3:4)) hope and glorious appearing of our great God and Savior Jesus Christ,

(Is. 53:12; Gal. 1:4) who gave Himself for us, that He might redeem us from every lawless deed (Ezek. 37:23; (Heb. 1:3; 9:14; 1 John 1:7)) and purify for Himself (Ex. 15:16) His own special people, zealous for good works.
Speak these things, (1 Tim. 4:13; 5:20; 2 Tim. 4:2) exhort, and rebuke with all authority. Let no one despise you.
Graces of the Heirs of Grace Remind them ((Rom. 13:1); 1 Pet. 2:13) to be subject to rulers and authorities, to obey, (Col. 1:10) to be ready for every good work,
to speak evil of no one, to be peaceable, gentle, showing all humility to all men.
For (1 Cor. 6:11; 1 Pet. 4:3) we ourselves were also once foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving various lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful and hating one another.
But when (Titus 2:11) the kindness and the love of (1 Tim. 2:3) God our Savior toward man appeared,
((Rom. 3:20); Eph. 2:4-9) not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to His mercy He saved us, through (John 3:3) the washing of regeneration and renewing of the Holy Spirit,
(Ezek. 36:26) whom He poured out on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Savior,
